business.name: Richard School NDIS Service For Autistic
business.tagline: Melbourne's Premier NDIS - Where Quality Meets Excellence

services.title: Daily Living Support
services.shortDescription: Assistance with everyday activities and personal care
services.description: Our compassionate support workers help participants with daily living activities including personal care, meal preparation, household tasks, and maintaining independence in their home. We focus on building skills and confidence while providing the support needed to live life on your terms.

services.title: Community Participation
services.shortDescription: Support to engage with your community
services.description: We support participants to access and engage with their local community. Whether it's attending social activities, pursuing hobbies, shopping, or accessing community facilities, our team provides the support needed to build connections and participate fully in community life.

services.title: Respite Care
services.shortDescription: Short-term support for participants and carers
services.description: Quality respite care providing a break for primary carers while ensuring participants receive excellent support. Available in-home or in community settings, our respite services are flexible and tailored to individual needs and preferences.

services.title: Therapy Services
services.description: Access qualified therapists including occupational therapists, speech pathologists, physiotherapists, and psychologists. Our allied health team works collaboratively to help participants achieve their therapy goals and improve quality of life.

services.title: Plan Management
services.shortDescription: Financial management of your NDIS plan
services.description: Take the stress out of managing your NDIS funding with our plan management services. We handle invoices, payments, and financial tracking while keeping you informed with regular statements and reports. Focus on your goals while we handle the paperwork.

services.title: Support Coordination
services.shortDescription: Help navigating and implementing your NDIS plan
services.description: Our experienced support coordinators help you understand your NDIS plan, connect with quality service providers, and ensure you're getting the most from your funding. We work alongside you to build your capacity and achieve your goals.

services.title: Specialist Disability Accommodation
services.description: Access to high-quality, purpose-built accommodation designed for people with significant functional impairment or high support needs. Our SDA properties feature the latest in accessibility and assistive technology to support independent living.

services.title: Employment Support
services.shortDescription: Support to find and maintain meaningful work
services.description: Our employment support services help participants explore career options, develop job-ready skills, find suitable employment, and receive ongoing support in the workplace. We work with employers to create inclusive opportunities.

faq.question: Are you a registered NDIS provider?
faq.answer: Yes, Richard School NDIS Service For Autistic is a registered NDIS provider. We meet all NDIS Quality and Safeguards Commission requirements and maintain our registration through regular audits and compliance checks.

faq.question: How do I access your services?
faq.answer: If you have an NDIS plan, contact us for a free consultation. We'll discuss your goals, review your plan, and create a support arrangement tailored to your needs. Call us on 0490348227 or fill out our contact form.

faq.question: What if I'm not on the NDIS yet?
faq.answer: We can help guide you through the NDIS access process and connect you with resources to apply. We also offer private fee services for those not yet on the NDIS.

faq.question: Can I choose my support workers?
faq.answer: Absolutely! We believe the relationship with your support worker is important. We match you with workers based on your preferences, goals, and personality, and you can request changes at any time.

faq.question: What areas do you service?
faq.answer: We provide services throughout Melbourne and surrounding areas in VIC. Contact us to confirm coverage in your location.

faq.question: How are your support workers qualified?
faq.answer: All our support workers hold relevant qualifications, current police checks, Working with Children checks, and NDIS Worker Screening. They receive ongoing training in disability support and person-centred practices.

faq.question: Can you help with plan management?
faq.answer: Yes! Our plan management service takes care of all the financial administration of your NDIS plan, including paying providers and tracking your budget, so you can focus on your goals.

faq.question: What happens if I need to cancel a service?
faq.answer: We understand circumstances change. We ask for 24 hours notice for cancellations where possible. We'll always work with you to reschedule and ensure you receive your support.

about.title: Melbourne's Trusted NDIS Provider Since 2020
about.story:
Richard School NDIS Service For Autistic was founded in 2020 with a commitment to providing compassionate, person-centred disability support services in Melbourne and surrounding areas.

Our team of qualified support workers are passionate about helping NDIS participants achieve their goals and live their best lives. We believe everyone deserves access to quality support that respects their individual needs, choices, and aspirations.

Whether you need daily living support, community participation, therapy services, or plan management, we're here to support you on your journey.
about.mission: Our mission is to empower NDIS participants through compassionate, person-centred support that promotes independence, choice, and quality of life.

values.title: Person-Centred
values.description: We put participants at the heart of everything we do, respecting individual choices and supporting personal goals.

values.title: Compassionate
values.description: Our team provides caring, understanding support that treats every participant with dignity and respect.

values.title: Professional
values.description: All our support workers are qualified, background-checked, and committed to delivering high-quality services.
